se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Interface StateParameter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dependent, Sampleable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RealParameter, RootedBifurcatingTreeParameter, RootedTreeParameter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BooleanMap, BooleanParameter, DoubleArrayMap, DoubleMap, DoubleParameter, GenericMap, IntArrayMap, IntMap, IntParameter, NamesMap, RBTree, RTree, StringMap, TimesMap

    public interface StateParameter
extends Dependent, Sampleable
    Interface for state parameters, for instance in an MCMC chain. A state parameter may e.g. be a vector or matrix, in which the individual elements are referred to as "sub-parameters".

    A state parameter is a Dependent, albeit typically a source in the DAG. Even though there may be interconnections between parameters (e.g. the times t of a tree S), it is often assumed that these are independent (although a Proposer which changes S usually also perturbs t).

    Importantly, a StateParameter which is perturbed is not by itself responsible for caching and restoring its contents. Rather, this is up to the Proposer which carried out the perturbation.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

      • getNoOfSubParameters

        int getNoOfSubParameters()
        Returns the number of sub-parameters, e.g. the number of elements if the parameter is a vector. For scalars, 1 should be returned.
        Returns:
        the number of sub-parameters; 1 for scalar parameters.
